member.summary: A throttle control to vary the animation speed of a controlled WBIAnimatedTexture

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.stopEffect
member.summary: Generators can play a stop effect when the generator is deactivated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.runningEffect
member.summary: Generators can play a running effect while the generator is running.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.isMissingResources
member.summary: Flag indicating whether or not we're missing resources needed to produce outputs.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.bypassRunCycle
member.summary: This flag lets an external part module bypass the converter's run cycle which is triggered by FixedUpdate. When this flag is set to true, then the base class's FixedUpdate won't be called. Without the base class' FixedUpdate getting called, no resources will be converted. The external part module is expected to call RunGeneratorCycle manually. This system was put in place to get around timing issues where gravitic generators should produce enough resources for warp coils to consume each time tick, but due to timing issues, the resources aren't produced in time for the warp engine to handle resource consumption. To get around that problem, the active warp engine handles resource conversion during its fixed update.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.RunGeneratorCycle
member.summary: This is a helper function to avoid issues where a warp engine needs a certain amount of resources in order to operate, the system should have them, but due to timing in the game, the resources aren't produced when they should be.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIModuleGeneratorFX.GetAmountProduced(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the amount of the supplied resource that is produced per second.
member.param: A string containing the name of the resource to look for.
member.returns: A double containing the amount of the resource produced, or 0 if the resource can't be found.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture
member.summary: This class lets you animate textures by displaying a series of images in sequence. You can animate a material's diffuse and emissive texture. You include several textures that act as the individual animation frames, and the part module will show them in sequence. This is NOT as efficient as a texture strip but it's the best I can do for now, and it's easier to set up the UV maps on the meshes being animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.debugMode
member.summary: A flag to enable/disable debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.moduleID
member.summary: The ID of the part module. Since parts can have multiple animated textures, this field helps identify them.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.textureTransformName
member.summary: Name of the transform whose textures will be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.animatedEmissiveTexture
member.summary: The name of the animated texture, like "WarpPlasma." The actual textures should be numbered in sequence (WarpPlasma1, WarpPlasma2, etc).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.animatedDiffuseTexture
member.summary: The name of the diffuse texture. It too can be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.minFramesPerSecond
member.summary: The minimum animation speed.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.maxFramesPerSecond
member.summary: The maximum animation speed. Testing shows that with frame updates happening every 0.02 seconds, that corresponds to 50 frames per second.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.emissiveFadeTime
member.summary: In seconds, how fast should the emissive fade when the animation isn't activated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.isActivated
member.summary: The activation switch. When not running, the animations won't be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.animationThrottle
member.summary: A throttle control to vary the animation speed between minFramesPerSecond and maxFramesPerSecond

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.fadesAtMinThrottle
member.summary: A toggle that indicates whether or not to fade out the animations when the animationThrottle is set to zero.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.blendTextures(System.Single,UnityEngine.Texture2D,UnityEngine.Texture2D,UnityEngine.Texture2D)
member.summary: Blends two textures together and stores the result in an output texture. Curtesy of stupid_chris
member.param: Percentage to blend through (from 0 to 1)
Beginning texture
Finishing texture
Texture to appear blended

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.getTextures(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all the textures for the specified name. If the name is "WarpPlasma" for instance, then the array of textures will have "WarpPlasma1" "WarpPlasma2" and so on. The method will keep looking for textures until it can no longer find a texture in the numbered sequence.
member.param: The base name of the texture to search for. It should have the relative path such as WildBlueIndustries/Blueshift/Parts/Engine/WarpPlasma.
member.returns: An array of string containing the numbered textures that comprise the animation.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil
member.summary:
Warp coils produce the warp capacity needed for vessels to go faster than light. Warp capacity is a fixed resource, but the resources needed to produce it are entirely optional.
` MODULE { name = WBIWarpCoil textureModuleID = WarpCoil warpCapacity = 10 RESOURCE { name = GravityWaves rate = 200 FlowMode = STAGE_PRIORITY_FLOW } } `

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.debugMode
member.summary: A flag to enable/disable debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.textureModuleID
member.summary: Warp coils can control WBIAnimatedTexture modules. This field tells the generator which WBIAnimatedTexture to control.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.runningEffect
member.summary: Warp coils can play a running effect while the generator is running.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.warpCapacity
member.summary: The amount of warp capacity that the coil can produce.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.isActivated
member.summary: The activation switch. When not running, the animations won't be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.statusDisplay
member.summary: Display string for the warp coil status.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.animationThrottle
member.summary: A control to vary the animation speed between minFramesPerSecond and maxFramesPerSecond

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.displacementImpulse
member.summary: Warp coils can efficiently move a certain amount of mass to light speed and beyond without penalties. Going over this limit incurs performance penalties, but staying under this value provides benefits. The displacement value is rated in metric tons.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.needsMaintenance
member.summary: Flag to indicate that the part needs maintenance in order to function.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.waterfallFXModule
member.summary: Optional (but highly recommended) Waterfall effects module

member.summary: Updates the MTBF rate multiplier with the new rate.
member.param: A double containing the new multiplier.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.UpdateMTBF(System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the warp core's EVA Repairs' MTBF, if any.

member.summary: Determines whether or not the warp coil has enough resources to operate.
member.param: The resource consumption rate multiplier
member.returns: True if the vessel has enough resources to power the warp coil, false if not.

member.summary: Returns the amount of resource required per second.

member.returns: A double containing the amount of required resource if it can be found, or 0 if not.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine
F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.moduleDescription
member.summary: Short description of the module as displayed in the editor.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.minPlanetaryRadius
member.summary: Minimum planetary radius needed to go to warp. This is used to calculate the user-friendly minimum warp altitude display.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.minWarpAltitudeDisplay
member.summary: Minimum altitude at which the engine can go to warp. The engine will flame-out unless this altitude requirement is met.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpSpeedDisplay
member.summary: The FTL display velocity of the ship, measured in C, that is adjusted for throttle setting and thrust limiter.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.maxWarpSpeedDisplay
member.summary: (Debug visible) Maximum possible warp speed.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.preflightCheck
member.summary: Pre-flight status check.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.spatialLocation
member.summary: Where we are in space.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.vesselCourse
member.summary: The vessel's course- which is really just the selected target.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.targetDistance
member.summary: Distance to the vessel's target

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.planetarySOISpeedCurve
member.summary: Limits top speed while in a planetary or munar SOI so we don't zoom past the celestial body. Out in interplanetary space we don't have a speed limit. The first number represents how close to the SOI edge the vessel is (1 = right at the edge, 0.1 = 10% of the distance to the SOI edge) The second number is the top speed multiplier.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.interstellarAccelerationCurve
member.summary: Whenever you cross into interstellar space, or are already in interstellar space and throttled down, then apply this acceleration curve. The warp speed will be max warp speed * curve's speed modifier. The first number represents the time since crossing the boundary/throttling up, and the second number is the multiplier. We don't apply this curve when going from interstellar to interplanetary space.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.interstellarPowerMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplies resource consumption and production rates by this multiplier when in interstellar space. Generators identified by warpPowerGeneratorID will be affected by this multiplier. Default multiplier is 10.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.displacementImpulse
member.summary: Warp engines can efficiently move a certain amount of mass to light speed and beyond without penalties. Going over this limit incurs performance penalties, but staying under this value provides benefits. The displacement value is rated in metric tons.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpCurve
member.summary: In addition to any specified PROPELLANT resources, warp engines require warpCapacity. Only parts with a WBIWarpCoil part module can generate warpCapacity. The warp curve controls how much warpCapacity is neeeded to go light speed or faster. The first number represents the available warpCapacity, while the second number gives multiples of C. You can apply any kind of warp curve you want, but the baseline uses the Fibonacci sequence * 10. It may seem steep, but in KSP's small scale, 1C is plenty fast. This curve is modified by the engine's displacementImpulse and current vessel mass. effectiveWarpCapacity = warpCapacity * (displacementImpulse / vessel mass)

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.waterfallWarpEffectsCurve
member.summary: Waterfall Warp Effects Curve. This is used to control the Waterfall warp field effects based on the vessel's current warp speed. The first number represents multiples of C, and the second number represents the level at which to drive the warp effects. The effects value ranges from 0 to 1, while there's no upper limit to multiples of C, so keep that in mind. The default curve is: key = 0 0 key = 1 0.5 key = 1.5 1

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.textureModuleID
member.summary: The name of the WBIAnimatedTexture to drive as part of the warp effects.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpPowerGeneratorID
member.summary: Engines can drive WBIModuleGeneratorFX that produce resources needed for warp travel if their moduleID matches this value.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.photonicBoomEffectName
member.summary: Optional effect to play when the vessel exceeds the speed of light.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpSimulationResource
member.summary: Used when calculating the max warp speed in the editor, this is the resource that is common between the warp engine, gravitic generator, and warp coil. This resource should be the limiting resource in the trio (the one that runs out the fastest).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.powerMultiplier
member.summary: The ratio between the amount of power produced for the warp coils to the amount of power consumed by the warp coils.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.displacementMultiplier
member.summary: The ratio between the total mass displaced by the warp coils to the vessel's total mass.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpIgnitionThreshold
member.summary: When the powerMultiplier drops below this value, the engine will flame out.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpEngineerSkill
member.summary: The skill required to improve warp speed. Default is "ConverterSkill" (Engineers have this)

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpSpeedBoostRank
member.summary: The skill rank required to improve warp speed.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpSpeedSkillMultiplier
member.summary: Per skill rank, the multiplier to multiply warp speed by.

member.summary: Due to the way engines work on FixedUpdate, the engine can determine that it is NOT flamed out if it meets its propellant requirements. Therefore, we keep track of our own flameout conditions.

member.summary: Finds any animated textures that should be controlled by the warp engine

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.calculateBestWarpSpeed
member.summary: Calculates the best possible warp speed from the vessel's active warp engines.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.getTotalWarpCapacity
member.summary: Calulates the total warp capacity from the vessel's active warp coils. Each warp coil must successfully consume its required resources in order to be considered.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.updateWarpPowerGenerators
member.summary: Updates the generators that provide warp power.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.disableGeneratorBypass
member.summary: In order to synchronize the converter's process with the active warp engine, we enable a generator bypass. The moment that we no longer need to do that, such as when the engine is shut down, or it flames out, we want to disable the bypass.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.shouldApplyWarp
member.summary: Looks for all the active warp engines in the vessel. From the list, only the top-most engine in the list of active engines should apply warp translation. All others simply provide support.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WFModuleWaterfallFX.#ctor(PartModule)
member.summary: Instantiates a new WFModuleWaterfallFX

member.name: M:Blueshift.WFModuleWaterfallFX.SetControllerOverride(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the override state for the specified controller.
member.param: A string containing the name of the controller to override.
A bool indicating whether or not to override the controller.

member.summary: Sets the override value for the specified controller
member.param: A string containing the name of the controller to override.
A float containing the override value.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WFModuleWaterfallFX.SetControllerValue(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the value for the specified controller

member.name: T:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario
member.summary: This class helps starships determine when they're in interstellar space.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.kLightYear
member.summary: Light-year unit of measurement. Abbreviated "Ly."

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.kGigaMeter
member.summary: Gigameter unit of measurement. Abbreviate "Gm."

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.kMegaMeter
member.summary: Megameter unit of measurement. Abbreviated "Mm."

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.messageDuration
member.summary: How long to display a screen message.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.shared
member.summary: Shared instance of the helper.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.debugMode
member.summary: Flag to indicate that the mod is in debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.interstellarWarpSpeedMultiplier
member.summary: When in intersteller space, vessels can go much faster. This multiplier tells us how much faster we can go. For comparison, Mass Effect Andromeda's Tempest can cruise at 4745 times light speed, or 13 light-years per day.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.autoCircularize
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether or not to auto-circularize the orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.circularizationResourceDef
member.summary: It can cost resources to auto-circularize a ship after warp.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.circularizationCostPerTonne
member.summary: How much circularizationResource does it cost per metric ton of ship to circularize its orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.spawnSpaceAnomalies
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether or not Space Anomalies are enabled.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.spawnJumpgates
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether or not Jumpgate anomalies are enabled.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.jumpgateStartupIsDestructive
member.summary: The jumpgate startup sequence is destructive. Stay clear!

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.maintenanceEnabled
member.summary: Flag to indicate if parts require maintenance.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.minRendezvousDistancePlanetary
member.summary: In meters, minimum distance in planetary space that's required to rendezvous with a vessel via auto-circularization.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.minRendezvousDistanceInterplanetary
member.summary: In meters, minimum distance in interplanetary space that's required to rendezvous with a vessel via auto-circularization.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.rendezvousDistance
member.summary: In meters, how close to the targed vessel should you end up at when you rendezvous with it during auto-circularization or a jump.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetHighestRank(Vessel,System.String,ProtoCrewMember@)
member.summary: Returns the highest ranking astronaut in the vessel that has the required skill.
member.param: The vessel to check for the highest ranking kerbal.
The name of the skill to look for. Examples include RepairSkill and ScienceSkill.
The astronaut that has the highest ranking skill.
member.returns: The skill rank rating of the highest ranking astronaut (if any)

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.AddJumpgateToNetwork(Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly)
member.summary: Adds the jumpgate anomaly to the network.
member.param: The WBISpaceAnomaly to add.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.AddJumpgateToNetwork(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the jumpgate to the network.
member.param: A string containing the ID of the jumpgate vessel.
A string containing the ID of the jumpgate network.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetDestinationGates(System.String,Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the list of possible destination gates that are in range of the specified origin point.
member.param: A string containing the network ID.
A Vector3d containing the origin point to check for gates in range.
A double containing the maximum jump range, measured in light-years. Set to -1 to ignore max jump range.
member.returns: A List of Vessel containing the vessels in the network that are in range, or null if no network or vessels in range could be found.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetAnomaly(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the anomaly matching the desired vesselID.
member.param: A string containing the vessel ID.
member.returns: A WBISpaceAnomaly if the anomaly can be found, or null if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetVessel(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to locate the destination vessel based on the ID supplied.
member.param: A string containing the vessel ID
member.returns: A Vessel if one can be found, null if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetSpatialLocation(Vessel)
member.summary: Determines thevessel's spatial location.
member.param: The Vessel to check.
member.returns: A WBISpatialLocations withe spatial location.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.IsAStar(CelestialBody)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the celestial body is a star.
member.param: The body to test.
member.returns: true if the body is a star, false if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.IsInInterstellarSpace(Vessel)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the vessel is in interstellar space.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.IsInSpace(Vessel)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the vessel is in space.
member.param: The Vessel to check.
member.returns: true if the vessel is in space, false if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetEveryLastPlanet
member.summary: Finds every last planet in every star system.
member.returns: A List of CelestialBody

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetStars
member.summary: Finds all the stars in the game.
member.returns: A Listcontaining all the stars in the game. Celestial bodies that are on the celestialBlacklist are ignored.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetPlanets
member.summary: Returns a list of all the planets in the game.
member.returns: A Listcontaining all the planets in the game. Celestial bodies that are on the celestialBlacklist are ignored.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetLastPlanet(CelestialBody)
member.summary: Finds the last planet in the supplied star system.
member.param: A Celestial Body that is the star to check.
member.returns: A CelestialBody representing the last planet in the star system (if any)

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.HasPlanets(CelestialBody)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the celestial body has planets orbiting it.
member.param: The CelestialBody to check for planets.
member.returns: true if the celestialBody has orbiting planets, false if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetDistanceToTarget(Vessel,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Calculates the distance and units of measurement to the vessel's target (if any).
member.param: The Vessel to check for targets.
A string representing the units of measurement computed for the distance.
A string representing the name of the vessel's target.
member.returns: A double containing the distance. If there is no target then the distance is 0.

member.name: M:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.GetParentStar(CelestialBody)
member.summary: Find the parent star of the celestial body.
member.param: The celestial body to check.
member.returns: A CelestialBody that is the query parameter's star, or null.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX
member.summary: This resource harvester add the ability to drive Effects, animated textures, and Waterfall.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.debugMode
member.summary: A flag to enable/disable debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.moduleTitle
member.summary: The module's title/display name.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.moduleDescription
member.summary: The module's description.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.moduleID
member.summary: The ID of the part module. Since parts can have multiple harvesters, this field helps identify them.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.guiVisible
member.summary: Toggles visibility of the GUI.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.textureModuleID
member.summary: Harvesters can control WBIAnimatedTexture modules. This field tells the generator which WBIAnimatedTexture to control.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.animationThrottle
member.summary: A throttle control to vary the animation speed of a controlled WBIAnimatedTexture

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.startEffect
member.summary: Harvesters can play a start effect when the generator is activated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.stopEffect
member.summary: Harvesters can play a stop effect when the generator is deactivated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.runningEffect
member.summary: Harvesters can play a running effect while the generator is running.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIModuleHarvesterFX.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly
member.summary: Describes a space anomaly. Similar to asteroids, space anomalies are listed as unknown objects until tracked and visited. Each type of anomaly is defined by a SPACE_ANOMALY config node.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.name
member.summary: Identifier for the space anomaly.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.partName
member.summary: Name of the part to spawn

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.vesselName
member.summary: Anomalies are typically named "UNK-" and a sequence of letters and numbers, but you can override the name of the vessel if desired. This field should be used with unique anomalies (maxInstances = 1).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.anomalyType
member.summary: Type of anomaly. Default is generic.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.sizeClass
member.summary: Like asteroids, space anomalies have a size class that ranges from Size A (12 meters) to Size I (100+ meters). The default is A.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.spawnMode
member.summary: How does an instance spawn

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.orbitType
member.summary: The type of orbit to create. Default is elliptical.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.maxDaysToClosestApproach
member.summary: For flyBy orbits, the max number of days until the anomaly reaches the closest point in its orbit. Default is 30.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.flyByOrbitChance
member.summary: For orbitType = random, on a roll of 1 to 100, what is the chance that the orbit will be flyBy. Default is 50.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedBody
member.summary: For fixedOrbit, the celestial body to spawn around.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedSMA
member.summary: For fixedOrbit, the Semi-Major axis of the orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedEccentricity
member.summary: For fixedOrbit, the eccentrcity of the orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedInclination
member.summary: Fixed inclination. Only used for fixedOrbit. If set to -1 then a random inclination will be used instead.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.minLifetime
member.summary: For undiscovered objects, the minimum number of seconds that the anomaly can exist. Default is 86400 (1 day). Set to -1 to use maximum possible value. When set to -1, maxLifetime is ignored.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.maxLifetime
member.summary: For undiscovered objects, the maximum number of seconds that the anomaly can exist. Default is 1728000 (20 days).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.expirationDate
member.summary: Timestamp when the anomaly expires. If set to -1 then it never expires.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.spawnTargetNumber
member.summary: Spawn chance in a roll between 1 and 1000

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.maxInstances
member.summary: Maximum number of objects of this type that may exist at any given time. Default is 10. Set to -1 for unlimited number.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.vesselId
member.summary: ID of the vessel as found in the FlightGlobals.VesselsUnloaded.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.isKnown
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether or not the gate should automatically be added to the network's known gates and/or is automatically tracked by the Tracking Station. If set to false (the default), then players must visit the gate in order for it to be added to the network. Applies to anomalyType = jumpGate.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.networkID
member.summary: Only gates with matching network IDs can connect to each other. Leave blank if the gate connects to any network. If there are only two gates in the network then there is no need to select the other gate from the list. You can add additional networks by adding a semicolon character in between network IDs. Applies to anomalyType = jumpGate.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.rendezvousDistance
member.summary: Overrides the jumpgate's rendezvous distance.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.CopyFrom(Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly)
member.summary: Copies the fields from another space anomaly.
member.param: The WBISpaceAnomaly whose fields we're interested in.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.Load(Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly,ConfigNode)
member.summary: Loads the ConfigNode data into the anomaly object.
member.param: A WBISpaceAnomaly to load the data into.
A ConfigNode containing serialized data.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Serializes the anomaly to a ConfigNode.
member.param: A string containing the name of the node.
member.returns: A ConfigNode with the serialized data.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.CreateNewInstancesIfNeeded(System.Collections.Generic.List{Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly})
member.summary: Checks to see if we should create a new instance.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock
member.summary: This part module is designed to unlock random nodes in a tech tree. It can also drive Waterfall effects.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.dieRoll
member.summary: Maximum RNG value

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.unlockTargetNumber
member.summary: Target number to unlock a tech tree node

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.unlockMessage
member.summary: Tech unlock message

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.animationThrottle
member.summary: A control to vary the animation speed between minFramesPerSecond and maxFramesPerSecond

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.hasBeenVisited
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether or not the part has been visited.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBITechUnlock.waterfallFXModule
member.summary: Optional (but highly recommended) Waterfall effects module

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourcePriceTiers.Planetary
member.summary: Planetary price tier

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourcePriceTiers.Interplanetary
member.summary: Interplanetary price tier

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourcePriceTiers.Interstellar
member.summary: Interstellar price tier

member.name: T:Blueshift.ResourceToll
member.summary: Defines a resource that must be paid in order to reach the desired destination. If defined, then the default mechanics are overridden.

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourceToll.name
member.summary: Name of the resource toll.

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourceToll.priceTier
member.summary: Price tier- one of: planetary, interplanetary, interstellar

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourceToll.resourceName
member.summary: Name of the resource required to pay the jump toll.

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourceToll.amountPerTonne
member.summary: Amount of resource per metric tonne mass of the traveler

member.name: F:Blueshift.ResourceToll.paidByTraveler
member.summary: Resource is paid by the traveler that is initiating the jump

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.debugMode
member.summary: A flag to enable/disable debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.textureModuleID
member.summary: This field tells the module which WBIAnimatedTexture to control.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.startupAnimation
member.summary: Animation to play before playing the portal effect.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.runningEffect
member.summary: Warp coils can play a running effect while the generator is running.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.effectSpoolTime
member.summary: In seconds, how quickly to throttle up the waterfall effect from 0 to 1.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.effectsThrottle
member.summary: A control to vary the animation speed between minFramesPerSecond and maxFramesPerSecond

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.networkID
member.summary: Only gates with matching network IDs can connect to each other. Leave blank if the gate connects to any network. If there are only two gates in the network then there is no need to select the other gate from the list. You can add additional networks by adding a semicolon character in between network IDs.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.gateAddress
member.summary: For paired gates, the address of the gate. This should be set using JUMPGATE_ANOMALY. Default is an empty address.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.pairedGateAddress
member.summary: For paired gates, the address of the paired gate. This should be set using JUMPGATE_ANOMALY. Default is an empty address.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.maxJumpRange
member.summary: If the gate has a limited jump range, then only those gates that are in the network and within range can be selected. The exception is a network of two gates; max range is ignored. Set to -1 (the default) for unlimited jump range. Units are in light-years (9460700000000000 meters)

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.jumpMaxDimensions
member.summary: Maximum width and height of the vessel that the gate can support.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.jumpMaxMass
member.summary: Since KSP's vessel measurements are so wacked when in flight, we'll use a maximum jump mass instead. Set to -1 (the default value) for unlimited mass.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.interactionRange
member.summary: Range at which players can interact with the gate's PAW. Default is 500 meters.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.portalTriggerTransform
member.summary: Name of the portal trigger transform. The trigger is a collider set to Is Trigger in Unity.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.triggerStartupScaleCurve
member.summary: Scale curve to use during startup. This should follow the Waterfall effect (if any). During the startup sequence the Z-axis will be scaled according to this curve. Any vessel or vessel parts caught by the portal trigger during startup will get vaporized unless "Jumpgates: desctructive startup" in Game Difficulty is disabled.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.rendezvousDistance
member.summary: Specifies the rendezvous distance. Default is 50 meters away from the gate's vessel transform. Set to -1 (the default) to use the value from Blueshift settings.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.waterfallFXModule
member.summary: Optional (but highly recommended) Waterfall effects module

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.vesselID
member.summary: The ID of the vessel when it was first created.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIJumpGate.SetGateEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables/disables the jumpgate.
member.param: A flag that sets the gate enabled/disabled.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIDockingAlignmentLock
member.summary: A simple helper class to lock the docking alignment.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIDockingAlignmentLock.lockAlignment
member.summary: Toggles docking alignment to locked/unlocked.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIGateAssemblyChecker
member.summary: A handy class for making sure that a jumpgate is fully assembled.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIGateAssemblyChecker.totalSegments
member.summary: Total number of segments to check.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIGateAssemblyChecker.primaryNodeName
member.summary: Name of the node to check for other gate segments.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIGateAssemblyChecker.secondaryNodeName
member.summary: Name of the node to check for other gate segments.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid
member.summary: A customized version of ModuleAsteroid to allow for standard asteroid functionality while avoiding the procedural mesh generation. This is helpful for custom asteroid anomalies like Oumuamua.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid.sampleAcquired
member.summary: Flag indicating that a sample of the asteroid has been acquired.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid.scienceExperiment
member.summary: The science experiment to run.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid.flightCoMTracker
member.summary: Tracker for the asteroid's center of mass.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid.OnStart(PartModule.StartState)
member.summary: Overrides the start method to avoid generating a procedural asteroid.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid.RunExperiment
member.summary: Replacement event for the asteroid's sample return experiment.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBICustomAsteroid.TargetCoM
member.summary: Replacement event for ModuleAsteroid's event to target the asteroid's center of mass.
